senses.de: A situation or condition that makes something more difficult or complex.
senses.ex: The strike has further added to the complications of the peace process.

Tips.title: Broad Usage
Tips.description: The word 'complication' implies that a situation not only becomes harder but also more complex.
Tips.example: Unpredictable weather causes complications for outdoor events.

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: 'Complication' often suggests negative outcomes which might need additional effort to overcome.
Tips.example: New laws brought complications to the hiring process.

Tips.title: Not Always Serious
Tips.description: Complications can range from minor inconveniences to significant issues.
Tips.example: Having too many cooks in the kitchen is a minor complication.

senses.de: A medical condition that arises during a disease, treatment or recovery that makes the situation worse.
senses.ex: There can be serious complications if the infection spreads to the lungs.

Tips.title: Medical Context
Tips.description: In medicine, 'complication' usually refers to unexpected problems following a diagnosis or surgery.
Tips.example: Postoperative complications may prolong hospital stay.

Tips.title: Seriousness
Tips.description: Medical complications are generally serious and often require professional intervention.
Tips.example: Diabetes can lead to complications like vision loss.

Tips.title: Technical Term
Tips.description: In healthcare, 'complication' is a technical term that should not be confused with everyday difficulties.
Tips.example: Bleeding is a known complication of surgery, not a difficulty.

senses.de: An additional feature or function in a machine or system that makes it more difficult to understand or operate.
senses.ex: The new software has many complications that make it challenging to use.

Tips.title: Technical Complexity
Tips.description: In technology, 'complication' refers to specific features that add complexity to a system or device.
Tips.example: Smartwatches have complications displaying additional data.

Tips.title: Not Always Bad
Tips.description: Technical complications can be seen as advancements, though they make the system complex.
Tips.example: The camera's complications enhance its versatility.

Tips.title: Understanding Required
Tips.description: Knowledge about the particular system is crucial to grasp the implications of its complications.
Tips.example: Without proper training, the software's complications can be daunting.

Complexity.wordDefinition:
Complexity refers to the state of having many interconnected parts or layers, which can make it difficult to fully understand or analyze a situation.

Complexity refers to the intricacy or difficulty of a system, while complication refers to extra difficulties or problems that arise in the course of dealing with it.

Difficult.wordDefinition:
Complication refers to an additional problem or difficulty that arises during a process, making it more complex or tricky to complete.

Difficult generally refers to something that is challenging or hard to do, but without the added element of unexpected challenges or obstacles.

- Studying for a test can be difficult, but if you also have to deal with a family emergency during the same time, that would be considered a complication.

- Climbing Mount Everest is difficult, but if you get sick partway up the mountain, that would be a complication.

Entanglement.wordDefinition:
Entanglement refers to a situation where things are intricately twisted or twisted together, making it difficult to separate them.

For example, if you have a knot in your headphone wires or your necklace gets tangled, that is entanglement. Entanglement refers to a situation where problems or things are intertwined and it's hard to untangle or separate them.

To sum up, complication implies that there is an added problem which makes a situation more problematic or difficult. Entanglement implies that there are problems that are interconnected and so become harder to tackle.

Hindrance.wordDefinition:
Hindrance refers to something that actively obstructs progress or slows down an activity.

A complication makes a situation more complex, while a hindrance actively impedes progress.

Complications can happen accidentally, while hindrances are often intentionally created to prevent progress.

Impediment.wordDefinition:
Impediment refers to anything that obstructs or hinders the progress of something.

It can be a physical obstacle, a speech impediment, or even a personal limitation. It is mostly used in social contexts, but can also be used in engineering and science.

In simple words, a complication is a problem that arises in a situation, whereas an impediment is a barrier that obstructs progress.

Both words indicate some sort of problem, but complication refers to a more complex issue, while impediment refers to a physical or social barrier.

Intricacy.wordDefinition:
Intricacy refers to something that is complex or detailed in design, structure, or process. For example, a piece of artwork might have intricate details or a computer program might have intricate code.

The difference between the two words is that complication implies difficulty, while intricacy implies complexity. Complication is more applicable when referring to problems, while intricacy is more applicable when referring to complex details or structures.

Obstacle.wordDefinition:
Obstacle refers to something that is preventing you from achieving a goal or completing a task. For example, if you are trying to climb a mountain and there is a big boulder blocking your path, that is an obstacle.

A complication is a problem that adds to an already difficult situation, while an obstacle is something that is stopping you from reaching your goal or completing a task.

Problem.wordDefinition:
A complication is something that makes a problem more difficult, it is an added hurdle or issue that arises during the course of dealing with a problem.

A problem is an issue that needs to be solved, something that is not going right or going as it should.

For example: if your problem is getting to school on time, a complication could be bad traffic or roadwork, making it harder for you to get there in time.

In this situation, traffic is the added issue that is making your problem more difficult.

A problem is the initial challenge you need to solve, while a complication is an obstacle that arises during the process of solving the problem.

Snag.wordDefinition:
A snag is a minor obstacle or hindrance that can be easily overcome. It may often be something that was expected, but still needs to be dealt with to move forward.

For example, a snag in a project might be missing some important information or a piece of equipment that needs to be ordered.

A complication is a bigger problem that requires more effort to address or solve, while a snag is a smaller, more manageable obstacle that can be quickly dealt with.

quotes.Text: I think, as journalists, we sometimes are afraid to enter into the emotional lives and the complications of the lives of the people we write about - we don't really have the space and the room to deal with those things. But as a novelist, that's precisely what you're writing about.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Hector Tobar

quotes.Text: We're a miserably violent species. But there's a complication, which is we don't hate violence, we hate the wrong kind. And when it's the right kind, we cheer it on, we hand out medals, we vote for, we mate with our champions of it. When it's the right kind of violence, we love it.
quotes.Title: American Scientist
quotes.Name: Robert Sapolsky

quotes.Text: Meanwhile the fact that the connection with the activity of memory in ordinary life is for the moment lost is of less importance than the reverse, namely, that this connection with the complications and fluctuations of life is necessarily still a too close one.
quotes.Title: German Psychologist
quotes.Name: Hermann Ebbinghaus

quotes.Text: Well, I believe that life is very complicated. And in a way, the only way you can show life in a truthful way is to show how complicated it is as an individual, but also your relation between a complicated life and the complications you have inside you.
quotes.Title: Swedish Writer
quotes.Name: Henning Mankell

quotes.Text: I work more now because at this time of my life I am not disturbed from my aim by outside pressures such as family, passionate relationships, dealing with 'who am I?' - those complications when one is searching for one's self.
quotes.Title: French Actress
quotes.Name: Jeanne Moreau

quotes.Text: I was raised in a sort of village. I have a huge family, and I think there is strength in that. It helped me to deal with some of the complications of living in the South because I always felt like I belonged, no matter what.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Chadwick Boseman

quotes.Text: There is always going to be depth and layers to people and that's what interests me in a character: when there is some problem to overcome, when there is a complication to understand in a person.
quotes.Title: French Actress
quotes.Name: Kalki Koechlin

quotes.Text: I'm a big dog fan. They're the best. They make life better, although they're hard to deal with. But complications in life are actually what make it fun.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Jon Hamm

quotes.Text: My way of expression is full of complications and mystery because that's my perception of life.
quotes.Title: Iranian Director
quotes.Name: Abbas Kiarostami

quotes.Text: I have come to terms with all the complications of my life.
quotes.Title: Indian Actor
quotes.Name: Prateik Babbar
